servinfo.title: DTC B1017: Power Source Voltage Low

servinfosub.title: Wiring Diagram
servinfosub.ptxt: Refer to DTC B1016: Power Source Voltage High .

attention2.ptxt: Be sure to observe instructions under CAUTION in “Air Bag Diagnostic System Check Flow”.

servinfosub.title: DTC Will Set when
servinfosub.ptxt: The power source voltage is below specified value for specified time.

ptxt.emph: Step 1: Check if voltage on battery is within normal range.
Step 2: Check if voltage applied to SDM is within normal range.
Step 3: Check if voltage applied to “L04” connector is within normal range.
Step 4: Check if DTC B1017 still exists.

action.ptxt: Check charging system and repair as necessary referring to Generator Test (Undercharged Battery Check) .

test1.ptxt: With ignition switch OFF, disconnect SDM connector.
Check proper connection to SDM at “G47-16” or “G46-11” terminal.
If OK, turn ignition switch ON and then check voltage between “G47-16” [A] or “G46-11” [B] terminal on SDM connector and body ground.
With ignition switch OFF, disconnect on connector “G01” junction block assembly.
If OK, turn ignition switch ON and then check voltage between “G01-15” terminal and body ground.

action.ptxt: Check circuit from battery to “G01” connector and charging system.

test1.ptxt: With ignition switch OFF, reconnect SDM connector.

testgroup.question: With ignition switch ON, does DTC B1017 exist?

action.ptxt: Substitute a known-good SDM and recheck.
Check charging system and repair as necessary referring to Generator Test (Undercharged Battery Check) .

attention3.ptxt: Upon completion of inspection and repair work, perform the following items.

item.ptxt: Reconnect all air bag system components and ensure all components are properly mounted.
Clear DTCs referring to DTC Clearance , if any.
Repeat Air Bag Diagnostic System Check to confirm that the trouble has been corrected.
